content.description:
Move straight up from the center of the north side of the Wall Street Boulder. Ever so slightly more difficult than Early Morning Trades, since you can not follow the large rift in the pancake layered rocks, leaving only large slopers and under clings to make your way straight up the boulder.

(Follow the light blue arrow in the Wall Street boulder route map)
content.protection: Bring pads, and watch out for the angle of the landing.
content.location: On the north side of Wall Street Boulder

content.description:
Easy warm up with large rounded pancake layers in the rock forming big, grippy slopers and a large rift in the rock to follow upward with large holds to find purchase with.

(Follow the orange arrow in the Wall Street boulder route map)
content.protection: Bring multiple sets of pads. Because of the angle of landing, and because of a fallen tree trunk, it can be a little sketchy.
content.location: On the north side of Wall Street Boulder

content.description: Start at a low start to the left of Low Stakes Trades. Make your way left to some slick holds to your left, and then make your way up the pancake layers, finding slopers along the way. Once it gets too sketchy and the slopers become near impossible, bailout to the right and finish on the top end of Low Stakes Trading.
content.protection: Bring multiple sets of pads. Because of the angle of landing, and because of some awkward young trees, it can be a little sketchy.
content.location: On the north side of Wall Street Boulder
